Transparency.justification: Score = 1 because 2 source(s) (listed below) contain detailed, verifiable information.

relevantSources.title: 3M Artificial Intelligence Exhibit
relevantSources.summary: The document outlines 3M's approach to AI transparency, requiring suppliers to provide information that enables 3M to understand and explain the logic and decision-making protocols employed by any AI system.

relevantSources.title: AI talk: What do LLMs know? And AI safety - 3M Inside Angle
relevantSources.summary: This blog explores what large language models (LLMs) know and how the field of research that explores what models represent grew out of a desire to build interpretable, explainable models.

Transparency.findings: 3M provides concrete evidence of AI transparency through supplier requirements that demand detailed information about AI systems' logic and decision-making processes. Their blog also discusses the importance of transparency in understanding AI models, reflecting a commitment to making AI systems more interpretable and accountable.

Fairness & Bias Mitigation.justification: Score = 1 because 4 source(s) (listed below) contain detailed, verifiable information.

relevantSources.title: 3M Artificial Intelligence Exhibit
relevantSources.summary: The document requires suppliers to explain the methods used to ensure AI systems and training data are not unfair, biased, or discriminatory, and prohibits AI systems that disproportionately rely on elements specific to protected classes.

relevantSources.title: 3M Supplier Responsibility Code
relevantSources.summary: The code establishes ethical standards for suppliers, including requirements that would apply to AI systems to ensure fair and non-discriminatory practices.

relevantSources.title: 3M's Code of Conduct - Ethics & Compliance
relevantSources.summary: 3M's Code of Conduct establishes core business principles that would guide fair and unbiased AI development and use.

relevantSources.title: AI talk: Responsible deployment of AI in healthcare
relevantSources.summary: This blog discusses responsible AI deployment in healthcare, including considerations for fairness and avoiding bias in healthcare AI applications.

Fairness & Bias Mitigation.findings: 3M's AI supplier requirements and codes of conduct explicitly prohibit unfair or discriminatory AI practices, mandating clear methods for bias mitigation. Their public materials and blogs also address fairness in AI, especially in sensitive domains like healthcare, providing concrete evidence of active bias mitigation efforts.

Explainability.justification: Score = 1 because 2 source(s) (listed below) contain detailed, verifiable information.

relevantSources.title: 3M Artificial Intelligence Exhibit
relevantSources.summary: The document includes a specific section on explainability, requiring suppliers to provide information that enables 3M to understand and explain the logic and decision-making protocols employed by any AI system.

relevantSources.title: AI talk: What do LLMs know? And AI safety - 3M Inside Angle
relevantSources.summary: The blog discusses explainability in AI models, noting that "the field of research that explores what models represent grew out of a desire to build interpretable, explainable models."

Explainability.findings: 3M requires explainability from its AI suppliers, ensuring that AI systems' logic and decision-making can be understood and articulated. Their blog further demonstrates a commitment to explainable AI by discussing the importance and evolution of interpretability in AI models.

Human Oversight & Accountability.justification: Score = 1 because 2 source(s) (listed below) contain detailed, verifiable information.

relevantSources.title: 3M Artificial Intelligence Exhibit
relevantSources.summary: The document outlines accountability requirements for AI suppliers, ensuring proper oversight of AI systems used by 3M.

relevantSources.title: 3M: 'We only use AI for complex problems we can't solve any other way'
relevantSources.summary: Paul Cardno, 3M's global digital innovation leader, explains that 3M only deploys AI "when we can't solve the problem any other way," indicating a careful, human-overseen approach to AI implementation.

Human Oversight & Accountability.findings: 3M's documentation and public statements show that human oversight and accountability are embedded in their AI deployment processes. They require supplier accountability and only use AI when necessary, emphasizing a human-in-the-loop approach to decision-making.

Privacy & Security.justification: Score = 1 because 2 source(s) (listed below) contain detailed, verifiable information.

relevantSources.title: 3M Artificial Intelligence Exhibit
relevantSources.summary: The document includes data security requirements for AI systems, ensuring protection against unauthorized access and vulnerabilities.

relevantSources.title: 3M Connected Safety Data Privacy and Security
relevantSources.summary: This whitepaper outlines 3M's approach to data privacy and security, including encryption, access controls, and governance policies that would apply to AI systems handling sensitive data.

Privacy & Security.findings: 3M's supplier requirements and whitepapers provide concrete details on privacy and security measures for AI systems, including data protection, encryption, and access controls. These artifacts demonstrate a robust approach to safeguarding data used in AI applications.

Governance & Accountability.justification: Score = 1 because 2 source(s) (listed below) contain detailed, verifiable information.

relevantSources.title: 3M Artificial Intelligence Exhibit
relevantSources.summary: The document outlines governance requirements for AI suppliers, ensuring compliance with applicable laws and regulations.

relevantSources.title: 3M: 'We only use AI for complex problems we can't solve any other way'
relevantSources.summary: The article discusses 3M's governance approach to AI, noting challenges around "shadow AI, copyright, bias, transparency, cross-jurisdictional compliance and ethical issues."

Governance & Accountability.findings: 3M's governance requirements for AI suppliers and public discussions of governance challenges show a structured approach to AI oversight and compliance. Their materials indicate an awareness of the complexities and risks associated with AI governance.

Public Commitments & External Audits.justification: Score = 1 because 2 source(s) (listed below) contain detailed, verifiable information.

relevantSources.title: 3M Supplier Responsibility Code
relevantSources.summary: The document outlines 3M's audit process for suppliers, which would include those providing AI systems.

relevantSources.title: 3M Expands Partnership with SymphonyAI Industrial for Digital Automation and Enterprise AI
relevantSources.summary: This press release announces 3M's expanded partnership with SymphonyAI Industrial, demonstrating a public commitment to responsible AI implementation in manufacturing.

Public Commitments & External Audits.findings: 3M's supplier code and public partnership announcements provide evidence of external audits and public commitments to responsible AI. These sources show that 3M is actively engaging in responsible AI practices and external validation.

summary.overallFindings: 3M demonstrates a comprehensive and mature approach to Responsible AI across all pillars, with strong evidence of transparency, fairness, explainability, and human oversight. The company provides detailed supplier requirements and public documentation addressing bias mitigation, privacy, security, and governance. Public commitments and external partnerships further reinforce 3M's responsible AI practices, indicating a high level of organizational readiness and accountability.
